criteria.name: PESTLE Comprehensiveness
criteria.1: Scans only 1-2 PESTLE dimensions, significant blind spots, cherry-picks domains
criteria.3: Covers 4-5 PESTLE dimensions systematically, minor gaps, reasonable source diversity
criteria.5: Comprehensive scan across all 6 PESTLE dimensions, diverse credible sources, systematic coverage with geographic/temporal breadth

criteria.name: Weak Signal Validation
criteria.1: Treats all anomalies as weak signals without validation, single sources, unclear amplification path
criteria.3: Validates signals using credibility + evidence criteria, plausibility assessed, some supporting evidence
criteria.5: Rigorous validation (source credibility, multiple confirmations, plausible amplification mechanism, significant impact if scaled), clear path from weak to mainstream

criteria.name: Scenario Plausibility
criteria.1: Scenarios are predictions/wishes rather than plausible futures, inconsistent logic, implausible combinations
criteria.3: Scenarios are plausible and internally consistent, span reasonable range of outcomes, based on critical uncertainties
criteria.5: Scenarios are distinct, plausible, internally consistent, span full range of critical uncertainties, include predetermined elements, challenge assumptions, vivid narratives

criteria.name: Cross-Impact Mapping
criteria.1: Trends treated in isolation, no interaction analysis, misses reinforcing/offsetting dynamics
criteria.3: Some interaction analysis, identifies key reinforcing or offsetting trends, distinguishes high/low impact
criteria.5: Comprehensive cross-impact matrix, reinforcing/offsetting/cascading relationships mapped, feedback loops identified, critical uncertainties vs predetermined elements distinguished

criteria.name: Signpost Quality
criteria.1: Signposts are lagging indicators, vague thresholds, unobservable or unmeasurable
criteria.3: Signposts are leading indicators with specific thresholds, observable, monitoring plan defined
criteria.5: Signposts are leading (6-12+ month lead time), specific quantitative thresholds, observable data sources identified, update frequency set, action triggers pre-committed, graduated alerts

criteria.name: Source Credibility
criteria.1: Relies on single source type or low-credibility sources, no validation, echo chamber
criteria.3: Mixes primary/secondary sources, includes credible sources (government, research, industry), some diversity
criteria.5: Source diversity across primary/secondary/edge, balances credibility vs novelty, geographic breadth, temporal depth, actively seeks disconfirming evidence

criteria.name: Strategic Implications
criteria.1: No connection to decisions, analysis without recommendations, unclear actionability
criteria.3: Strategic implications identified for key scenarios, connects to business decisions, some actionability
criteria.5: Clear strategic implications for each scenario, no-regrets moves identified, hedges specified, decision triggers defined, robust across scenarios, actionable recommendations

criteria.name: Uncertainty Management
criteria.1: Treats uncertainties as predictions, assigns false precision, ignores ranges and confidence
criteria.3: Distinguishes high/low uncertainty, acknowledges unknowns, uses scenarios to span range
criteria.5: Explicit uncertainty quantification (high impact + high uncertainty = critical, high impact + low uncertainty = predetermined), wild cards acknowledged, confidence calibrated, avoids false precision

criteria.name: Temporal Scope
criteria.1: Time horizon mismatched to questions (too short/long), snapshots without trend analysis, recency bias
criteria.3: Appropriate time horizon (1-2yr, 3-5yr, or 5-10yr based on need), some historical context, trends tracked
criteria.5: Time horizon matched to strategic planning cycle, historical patterns analyzed (10-20yr lookback), trend trajectories projected, inflection points identified, milestones defined

criteria.name: Update Mechanism
criteria.1: One-time scan, no monitoring plan, static scenarios, stale data
criteria.3: Monitoring cadence defined (quarterly/annual), some plan for updates, signposts tracked
criteria.5: Comprehensive update plan (daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly/annual by indicator type), scenario validation process, scan refinement based on new signals, feedback loop to strategy

key_requirements: Technology trends (PESTLE-T) comprehensive with patent/startup/VC data
Weak signals from edge sources (startups, research labs, adjacent fields)
Scenarios focus on disruption speed (rapid vs gradual) and winning model (incumbent vs entrant)
Signposts track technology readiness (TRL progression), adoption curves, incumbent response
common_pitfalls: Overweighting hype cycles, treating all startups as weak signals
Linear extrapolation of exponential tech trends

key_requirements: Political & Legal dimensions (PESTLE-P,L) prioritized with legislative tracking
Weak signals from pilot programs, consultations, lead jurisdictions
Scenarios span stringency (light vs heavy) and speed (gradual vs sudden)
Signposts track proposals, stakeholder positions, enforcement patterns
common_pitfalls: Assuming current policy trajectory continues unchanged
Ignoring industry lobbying and capture dynamics

key_requirements: Social & Economic dimensions (PESTLE-S,E) deep, demographics and values shifts
Weak signals from subcultures, Gen Z behavior, influencer/creator economy
Scenarios explore value proposition evolution, channel dominance, price sensitivity
Signposts track early adopter behavior, sentiment, spending patterns
common_pitfalls: Overgeneralizing from small samples or vocal minorities
Confusing stated preferences with revealed behavior

key_requirements: Political & Economic dimensions (PESTLE-P,E) comprehensive, global scope
Weak signals from diplomatic incidents, capital flows, social unrest indicators
Scenarios span geopolitical alignment (cooperation vs fragmentation), economic regime (growth vs stagnation)
Signposts track leading indicators (yields, commodity prices, policy shifts)
common_pitfalls: Treating low-probability tail risks as negligible

key_requirements: Environmental dimension (PESTLE-E) deep with climate models, plus Political/Legal for policy
Weak signals from physical anomalies, stranded asset warnings, investor ESG shifts
Scenarios span transition speed (orderly vs disorderly), policy stringency, physical impacts
Signposts track carbon pricing, renewable cost curves, extreme weather frequency, commitments
common_pitfalls: Underestimating physical risks or transition risks
Ignoring just transition and social equity dimensions
Linear climate projections ignoring tipping points

Simple/Focused Scan.description: Single domain or narrow question, limited geographic scope, short time horizon (1-2yr)
key_requirements: 3-4 PESTLE dimensions covered (focus on most relevant)
2-3 validated weak signals from credible sources
2-3 simple scenarios (baseline, upside, downside)
3-5 leading signposts with clear thresholds

Moderate/Strategic Planning.description: Multi-domain scan, regional/national scope, medium time horizon (3-5yr)
key_requirements: All 6 PESTLE dimensions systematically covered
5-8 validated weak signals with amplification paths assessed
3-4 scenarios (2x2 matrix method) with narratives and implications
8-12 signposts with graduated alerts (yellow/orange/red)
Cross-impact analysis identifying feedback loops

Complex/Comprehensive Foresight.description: System-level scan, global scope, long time horizon (5-10yr), high stakes
key_requirements: PESTLE comprehensive with geographic breadth and temporal depth (10yr+ lookback)
10+ validated weak signals from edge sources, expert panels (Delphi)
4 scenarios with wild cards, advanced methods (backcasting, morphological analysis)
15+ signposts with real-time monitoring, dashboards, automated alerts
Cross-impact with system dynamics modeling, sensitivity analysis
Complex/Comprehensive Foresight.time_estimate: 40-60 hours initial, facilitated workshops, 8-12 hours/quarter updates

common_failure_modes.symptom: All sources support existing strategy, no disconfirming evidence, echo chamber
common_failure_modes.detection: Check source diversity, political/ideological spectrum, opposing views absent
common_failure_modes.fix: Actively seek contrarian sources, assign devil's advocate, scan opposing geographies/sectors

common_failure_modes.symptom: Every anomaly labeled weak signal, no validation, dozens of signals without prioritization
common_failure_modes.detection: Weak signals lack credibility assessment, supporting evidence, or plausibility analysis
common_failure_modes.fix: Apply validation framework rigorously (credibility + evidence + plausibility + impact), prioritize top 5-10

common_failure_modes.symptom: Probabilities assigned to scenarios, betting on one scenario, scenarios converge
common_failure_modes.detection: Language like 'most likely scenario', resource allocation to single scenario, lack of hedges
common_failure_modes.fix: Frame scenarios as 'what if' not 'what will', test strategy robustness across all, identify no-regrets moves

common_failure_modes.symptom: Trends projected unchanged, ignores saturation/reversal/inflection, recent past = future
common_failure_modes.detection: Exponential trends extended indefinitely, no consideration of limits or feedback
common_failure_modes.fix: Analyze historical patterns for cycles, identify saturation limits, map feedback loops, consider discontinuities

common_failure_modes.symptom: Signposts are outcome measures (market share, GDP) not leading indicators
common_failure_modes.detection: Indicators move after trend materializes, no advance warning, reactive not proactive
common_failure_modes.fix: Identify indicators with 6-12+ month lead time (permits not prices, proposals not laws, VC not revenue)

common_failure_modes.symptom: Only 2-3 PESTLE dimensions scanned, missing entire domains, blind spots
common_failure_modes.detection: Environmental or Legal dimensions absent, geographic scope limited to home market
common_failure_modes.fix: Systematically cover all 6 PESTLE, even if some seem less relevant (surprises come from blind spots)

common_failure_modes.symptom: Scenarios created once and never updated, signposts not monitored, strategy unchanged despite shifts
common_failure_modes.detection: Scenario document >2 years old, no monitoring cadence, environmental shifts ignored
common_failure_modes.fix: Quarterly signpost reviews, annual scenario validation, trigger-based updates when thresholds crossed

common_failure_modes.symptom: Endless scanning without synthesis, hundreds of trends tracked, no strategic implications
common_failure_modes.detection: Reports are data dumps not decision memos, no clear recommendations, 'more research needed'
common_failure_modes.fix: Time-box scanning (80/20 rule), focus on critical uncertainties, prioritize actionability over comprehensiveness

common_failure_modes.symptom: Trends analyzed in isolation, interaction effects ignored, surprised by feedback loops
common_failure_modes.detection: No cross-impact matrix, reinforcing/offsetting dynamics not mapped, additive not multiplicative thinking
common_failure_modes.fix: Create interaction matrix, identify feedback loops (A→B→C→A), distinguish critical uncertainties from predetermined

common_failure_modes.symptom: Focus only on likely scenarios, low-probability high-impact events dismissed, no contingencies
common_failure_modes.detection: Scenarios all moderate outcomes, no discussion of tail risks or black swans, no resilience planning
common_failure_modes.fix: Explicitly list wild cards (pandemic, breakthrough, collapse), create contingency for high-impact events, stress-test strategy
